titleStmt.title: A breviate of the life of VVilliam Laud, Arch-bishop of Canterbury extracted (for the most part) verbatim, out of his owne diary, and other writings, under his owne hand : collected and published at the speciall instance of sundry honourable persons, as a necessary prologue to the history of his tryall, for which the criminall part of his life, is specially reserved / by William Prynne of Lincolnes Inne, Esquier [sic].
titleStmt.author: Prynne, William, 1600-1669.

titleStmt.title: A breviate of the life of VVilliam Laud, Arch-bishop of Canterbury extracted (for the most part) verbatim, out of his owne diary, and other writings, under his owne hand : collected and published at the speciall instance of sundry honourable persons, as a necessary prologue to the history of his tryall, for which the criminall part of his life, is specially reserved / by William Prynne of Lincolnes Inne, Esquier [sic].
titleStmt.author: Prynne, William, 1600-1669.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by F.L. for Michaell Sparke, Senior ...,

notesStmt.note: "It is ordered this sixteenth day of August 1644 by the Committee of the House of Commons assembled in Parliament concerning printing, that this booke intituled, A breviate of the life of William Laud, &c., bee printed by Michaell Sparke, Senior. John VVhite"
Reproduction of original in Huntington Library.
